I recently got a match and was 1st place- First strike, last strike, bomber and fighter achivements with only the first Buffalo plane. I also shot down my first plane there...

My most effective tactic (but is an accedent) is ramming

Take my advice.. learn to actually shoot. If you start relying on ramming, especially in reserve planes, to get kills, you'd better prepare to be disliked by the majority of the playerbase.

I would not expect them to fix that, the minimum requirements say you need a dedicated GPU.

Which is exactly why I might not continue playing if it continues to act out- I can't afford to build a new system at the moment, and laptop GPUs can't be upgraded.

It only happens on certain maps though, making me think it's a software issue that can be fixed. Some maps fly fine, others freak out and lock up. Even a lot of systems with reasonable GPUs in them are affected too.

Just one of those where the developers of this have pushed the stats up so far that systems older than a year or two outright can't run it. My own is just over two years now, and aside from the IGP it was a mid-range model when I picked it out.

Ramming is BAD. People will rage about it. It's understandable when you're learning to fly and caught up in the firefight to the point where you and your opponent run head on into each other frantically shooting, but later on people will complain about it if you do it on purpose.

I dislike rammers too. I don't rely on it, I shoot stuff. I was stating that I ACCEDENTLY ram people, and thats the majority of my air kills lol.
Absolutely nothing at all wrong with ramming. It's just as likely to take out your own plane too, and it's a legitimate tactic in real-life dogfighting as well.

Keep in mind that ramming usually just counts as a crash for both parties rather than as a kill. In fact, someone rammed me from behind earlier today and it actually ended up counting as a kill for me (probably because my rear gunner had nicked him beforehand).

Probably going to spend a fair bit of tomorrow learning all the controls. There used to be a time when I could fly with only the keyboard, but that day seems to be long past (as I've learned from painful experience tonight), and I don't have a decent joystick (though I might grab one after I get my paycheck).

Ah well. Progress is slow but measurable.
